opendial.modules.core

Class RemoteConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.modules.core.RemoteConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Module

    public class RemoteConnector
extends java.lang.Object
implements Module
    Module used to connect OpenDial to other remote clients (for instance, in order to conduct Wizard-of-Oz experiments).
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-11-15 00:14:12 #$ *
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Logger log 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RemoteConnector(DialogueSystem system)
      A server socket is created, using an arbitrary open port (NB: the port can be read in the "About" page in the GUI).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Connects to a new IP address and port (after startup).

      Returns the local address of the system, in the form Ip_address:port
      boolean isRunning()
      Returns true if the system is running, and false otherwise

      Pauses the connector

      Starts the connector.

    • Field Detail

      • log

        public static Logger log

    • Constructor Detail

      • RemoteConnector

        public RemoteConnector(DialogueSystem system)
                throws DialException
        A server socket is created, using an arbitrary open port (NB: the port can be read in the "About" page in the GUI).
        Parameters:
        system - the local dialogue system
        Throws:
        DialException - if the server socket could not be opened

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the connector. If the system settings include remote connections, connects to them by sending an INIT message.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Module

      • connectTo

        public void connectTo(java.lang.String address,
                      int port)
        Connects to a new IP address and port (after startup). Note that the remote connection must also be present in the system settings.
        Parameters:
        address - the IP address.
        port - the port to employ

      • trigger

        public void trigger(DialogueState state,
                    java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> updatedVars)
        Sends the updated variables through the socket connection.
        Specified by:
        trigger in interface Module
        Parameters:
        state - the dialogue state
        updatedVars - the set of updated variables

      • pause

        public void pause(boolean toPause)
        Pauses the connector
        Specified by:
        pause in interface Module
        Parameters:
        toPause - whether to pause or resume the module

      • getLocalAddress

        public java.lang.String getLocalAddress()
        Returns the local address of the system, in the form Ip_address:port
        Returns:
        the local address of the system

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Returns true if the system is running, and false otherwise
        Specified by:
        isRunning in interface Module
        Returns:
        whether the module is running or not
